intro: Keetia semsei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its woolly, hairy leaves. Keetia semsei typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique blooming pattern makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
